title: Daily Note - 2025-06-27
summary: A productive day focused on overhauling the Collapsi game logic, specifically fixing movement rules to allow direction changes using DFS pathfinding, updating the backend API, and significantly polishing the web UI with multiple themes and improved responsiveness.
accomplishments: Fixed core game logic by rewriting `get_valid_moves()` to use DFS pathfinding allowing orthogonal movement with direction changes
Updated backend API to work with destination-based moves
Implemented 5 themes (Cyberpunk, Classic Board, Neon Nights, Minimalist, Retro Arcade) with localStorage persistence
Polished UI by removing confusing path visualization, fixing layout to fit on one screen, and making it responsive
insights: Allowing direction changes during movement makes the game significantly more strategic
DFS pathfinding is computationally manageable for 4x4 board with max 4 moves
Simple click-to-destination UI is more intuitive than path building
Theme system adds nice personalization without complexity
learning: Game rules documentation (realized movement allows turns!)
DFS with backtracking is perfect for small board pathfinding
challenges: Initial misconception about Collapsi game movement rules
future_work: Test game engine thoroughly with edge cases
